717751f-a.text:
Trinity Chapel (i.e., Chapel of the Intercession), Broadway at the S.E. corner of 155th Street. May, 1924. P.L. Sperr. (No reproductions).

Looking southwest from 155th Street.

717753f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, west side, from 155th to 156th Streets. The nearer building is the Museum of the American Indian, while the farther one houses the American Geographic Society.
May, 1924.
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
A detail of the same, showing solely the Museum of the American Indian at the N.W. corner of West 156th Street.

May 1924.
P.L. Sperr

717753f-b.text:
(1)
Broadway, west side, from 155th to 156th Streets. The nearer building is the Museum of the American Indian, while the farther one houses the American Geographic Society.
May, 1924.
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
A detail of the same, showing solely the Museum of the American Indian at the N.W. corner of West 156th Street.

May 1924.
P.L. Sperr

717752f-a.text:
Broadway (Boulevard), west side, north from and including 155th, to and including 156th Streets. Also shown is 155th Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Broadway. Housed in these buildings are the American Numismatic Society, The Hispanic Society of America, The Museum of The American
Indian and The American Geographical Society.
About 1930.
Ewing Galloway.

717754f-a.text:
The American Geographical Society, the Museum of the American Indian, and the Hispanic Society, Broadway, west side, from 156th to 155th Streets.
About 1926.

Brown Brothers.

717755f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, between West 155th and West 156th Streets, showing the Hispanic Society of America Building. It faces on a promenade across which is the Library Building (left foreground), and the rear wall faces on West 155th Street. The entrance to the Hispanic Society is
through the promenade.
1936.
W. P. A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.

717750f-b.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, at West 155th Street. Shown on the S.E. corner of 155th Street, is Trinity Chapel P.E.
April 13, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
April 13, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
